alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued November 04 at 2:51AM MDT until November 05 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 PM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...West winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 80 mph possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...From 12 PM MDT Friday to 9 PM MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Widespread strong crosswinds could create significantly hazardous travel for all motorists on Interstate 80 between mile markers 240 and 290...especially for light weight and high profile vehicles...including light load semis and those towing camper trailers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing snow will be possible from the recent snowfall that could reduce visibility and create slick road conditions at times.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.
